intro: Pseudobastardia tiubae f. annua, commonly known as the annual form of the bastardia plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
